com.yantra.yfc.rcp

Class YRCComboBindingData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCComboBindingData
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    YRCDynamicComboBindingData

    public class YRCComboBindingData
extends java.lang.Object
    Instances of this class provide binding, behavioral and name information about combo controls.
    Usage: For binding a combo box one has to create an instance of the class YRCComboBindingData. Structure of a sample model used for input: <Order> <OrderStatusList> <OrderStatus Status="1001" StatusDesc="Created"/> <OrderStatus Status="1002" StatusDesc="Packed"/> <OrderStatus Status="1003" StatusDesc="Released"/> <OrderStatus Status="1004" StatusDesc="Shipped"/> </OrderStatusList> </Order>
    Example Code:
    //Create a binding object that has to be associated with a control. YRCComboBindingData oCmbData = new YRCComboBindingData(); //Set the name of the control. The control name should be unique. oCmbData.setName("cmbStatus"); //Set the target binding. By setting the target binding we can use the value in the combo box to populate //the entries in the corresponding model. oCmbData.setTargetBinding("/Order/@Status"); //Set the list binding for a Combo. By setting the list binding, we specify the path where from it will fetch //the values to be displayed in the combo box. For example, using the sample model shown above we wish to //display Status Description (StatusDesc) on the screen, and for a selected field we wish to use the key value //Status (Status). Then, specify the xml path to the recurring element "OrderStatus" as the ListBinding of the //data object. oCmbData.setListBinding("Order/OrderStatusList/OrderStatus"); //Next set the Description Binding. This value is displayed to the end-user at the screen. //Set the Attribute corresponding to the element specified in the List Binding. Here we use the attribute: //"StatusDesc" as the description of the status. oCmbData.setDescriptionBinding("StatusDesc"); //Set the key value that should be selected when the end-user selects an option from the drop-down menu of //the Combo. This value will be the output of the control. oCmbData.setCodeBinding("Status"); //Finally set the binding data on the control. The key used is: YRCConstants.YRC_COMBO_BINDING_DEFINATION cmbStatus.setData(YRCConstants.YRC_COMBO_BINDING_DEFINATION,oCmbData);
    See Also:
    YRCDynamicComboBindingData

    • Method Detail

      • isLocalized

        public boolean isLocalized()

      • setLocalized

        public void setLocalized(boolean isLocalized)
        Boolean to indicate if the description of the combo options needs to be localized by using the localized strings defined in the database. The value of the getDescriptionBinding() is used as the key to the call to YRCPlatformUI.getDBString(String). Default is false.

      • getCodeBinding

        public java.lang.String getCodeBinding()

      • setCodeBinding

        public void setCodeBinding(java.lang.String codeBinding)
        Set the key value that should be selected when the end-user selects an option from the drop-down menu of the Combo. This value will be the output of the control.

      • getDescriptionBinding

        public java.lang.String getDescriptionBinding()

      • setDescriptionBinding

        public void setDescriptionBinding(java.lang.String descriptionBinding)
        This value is displayed to the end-user on the screen. Set the attribute corresponding to the element specified in the List Binding.

      • getListBinding

        public java.lang.String getListBinding()

      • setListBinding

        public void setListBinding(java.lang.String listBinding)
        Set the list binding for a Combo. By setting the list binding, we specify the path to fetch the values to be displayed in the combo box.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Name to be set on the combo control associated with this binding object.
        Name of the control is used for the following purposes:
        • To enable differential extensibility.
        • To access control value by name from behavior and extension behavior classes.
        • To do custom validations through extension behavior.
        See Also:
        YRCExtentionBehavior.validateComboField(String, String)

      • getSourceBinding

        public java.lang.String getSourceBinding()

      • setSourceBinding

        public void setSourceBinding(java.lang.String sourceBinding)
        Source binding of the control. Source binding is used to populate values of the control from an xml model.
        See Also:
        YRCBehavior.setModel(String, Element), YRCExtentionBehavior.setExtentionModel(String, Element)

      • getTargetBinding

        public java.lang.String getTargetBinding()

      • setTargetBinding

        public void setTargetBinding(java.lang.String targetBinding)
        Target binding of the control. Target binding is used to fetch the data from the control into an xml document.
        See Also:
        YRCBaseBehavior.getTargetModel(String, boolean)

      • getThemeName

        public java.lang.String getThemeName()

      • setThemeName

        public void setThemeName(java.lang.String themeName)
        Name of the Theme entry to be used. Note: Only used for combo controls which are used within a editable table.

      • isMandatory

        public boolean isMandatory()

      • setMandatory

        public void setMandatory(boolean isMandatory)
        Boolean to indicate if the combo is mandatory. If the combo is not mandatory then a empty option is automatically added to the combo during population of the options. Default is false.

      • getKey

        public java.lang.String getKey()

      • setKey

        public void setKey(java.lang.String key)
        The resource bundle key to be used to display data in the combo control when there are multiple source bindings set in the setSourceBinding(String) method.

      • isBundleDriven

        public boolean isBundleDriven()

      • setBundleDriven

        public void setBundleDriven(boolean isBundleDriven)
        Boolean to indicate if the description of the combo options needs to be localized by using the resource bundle. The value of the getDescriptionBinding() is used as the key to the resource bundle. Default is false.
        See Also:
        getDescriptionBinding()

      • getVisibleItemCount

        public int getVisibleItemCount()
        Returns number of items that are visible in the drop down portion of the Combo list or -1 for default Combo value.
        Returns:
        the number of items that are visible
        See Also:
        setVisibleItemCount(int), YRCUIUtils.setComboVisibleItemCount(int)

      • setVisibleItemCount

        public void setVisibleItemCount(int visibleItemCount)
        Sets the number of items that are visible in the drop down portion of the combo list. If set, it will ignore the value set globally Preference- Combo.getVisibleItemCount << YRCUIUtils.getComboVisibleItemCount << YRCComboBindingData.getVisibleItemCount
        Parameters:
        visibleItemCount - the new number of items to be visible
        See Also:
        YRCUIUtils.setComboVisibleItemCount(int)

        This utility method can be called when contents of the Combobox are Application version specific.
        Parameters:

      • isDescriptionDynamic

        public boolean isDescriptionDynamic()
        Utility method to check if the value to be displayed in the Combo box is dynamic.
        Returns:
        true if the value to be displayed in the Combo box is dynamic.

      • setDescriptionDynamic

        public void setDescriptionDynamic(boolean isDynamic)
        Utility method to set that the value to be displayed in the Combo box is dynamic. Dynamic value to be displayed has to evaluated and returned in the evaluateDynamicBinding() method of the behavior class. If value returned is void, value to be displayed will be picked from description binding. Localization of the returned value will be handled by Platform RCP Infrastructure.
        Parameters:
        isDynamic -
